intro: Tylophora tonsa, commonly known as the red-flowered tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to red in color. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds. Tylophora tonsa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
